security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill with no executable code. It provides instructions for generating markdown session summaries. No file system access, network calls, or command execution capabilities detected. The behavior matches the stated purpose exactly.

content.user_title: Save session context for new windows
content.value_statement: Context switching between AI sessions causes lost progress and repeated work. This skill automatically generates structured markdown summaries that capture tasks, files, and next steps so new AI windows can resume work instantly.
actual_capabilities: Summarize current session context including tasks and progress
Generate structured markdown files in docs/context-sessions/
Track completed and pending tasks with priority levels
Document key files and technical decisions
Provide actionable next steps for resuming work
limitations: Requires the context-resume skill to restore sessions
Only creates files in the docs/context-sessions/ directory
Does not handle binary files or media content
Requires user to trigger with the specific phrase

use_cases.title: Switch between projects
use_cases.description: Save progress on one project and resume exactly where you left off when returning

use_cases.title: Preserve complex workflows
use_cases.description: Document ongoing work so context is never lost during extended development sessions

use_cases.title: Hand off work seamlessly
use_cases.description: Create session summaries that help others quickly understand current project state

best_practices: Trigger context-save before switching tasks or taking breaks
Keep task descriptions specific and actionable
Review the generated markdown for accuracy before resuming
anti_patterns: Calling context-save without meaningful progress to document
Leaving vague or outdated task descriptions in summaries
Skipping the context-resume step when starting a new window

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. No additional configuration required.

faq.question: How many sessions can I save?
faq.answer: Unlimited sessions can be saved. Each creates a separate markdown file in docs/context-sessions/.

faq.question: How do I resume a saved session?
faq.answer: Use the context-resume skill to load a session file and restore all context information.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All data stays local. Files are saved in your project directory without any external network calls.

faq.question: Why is my saved file not showing up?
faq.answer: Check that docs/context-sessions/ directory exists. Verify the filename format matches YYYYMMDD-HHMM-description.md

faq.question: How does this compare to Claude's memory feature?
faq.answer: This skill creates persistent, project-specific files you can version control and share with team members.
